outline:
1. to lodge, stop over, pass the night, abide
    1. (Qal)
      1. to lodge, pass the night
      2. to abide, remain (fig.)
    2. (Hiphil) to cause to rest or lodge
    3. (Hithpalpel) to dwell, abide
  2. to grumble, complain, murmur
    1. (Niphal) to grumble
    2. (Hiphil) to complain, cause to grumble
kjv_def: abide (all night), continue, dwell, endure, grudge, be left, lie all night, (cause to) lodge (all night, in, -ing, this night), (make to) murmur, remain, tarry (all night, that night).
strongs_def: to stop (usually over night); by implication, to stay permanently; hence (in a bad sense) to be obstinate (especially in words, to complain)
